alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 5:57PM EDT until September 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... East central Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 557 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Tobyhanna to near McMichael to near Northampton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Belvidere, Oxford, Belfast, Tatamy, East Bangor, Steuben, Stormville, Werry Lake, Skytop, Tannersville and Reeders. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 297 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 8. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
